com.here.android.mpa.routing

Class RouteOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteOptions
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    UMRouteOptions

    public class RouteOptions
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the definition of the RouteOptions class. The class contains options for route calculation.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RouteOptions.HazardousGoodType
      Defines names for different types of hazardous goods that can be transported by a truck.
      static class  RouteOptions.PublicTransportLinkFlag
      Public Transport Link Flag.
      static class  RouteOptions.SpeedProfile
      Route calculation vehicle speed profile.
      static class  RouteOptions.TimeType
      Ways that the time can be specified.
      static class  RouteOptions.TransportMode
      Represents values describing different mode of transportation a person will be using.
      static class  RouteOptions.TruckRestrictionsMode
      Defines way of handling road segments on which violated static truck restriction applies.
      static class  RouteOptions.TruckType
      Defines names for different types of trucks.
      static class  RouteOptions.TunnelCategory
      Specify the ADR tunnel category to restrict the truck route to.
      static class  RouteOptions.Type
      Represents different types of routing, such as by speed or by distance.

        public RouteOptions setPublicTransportTypeAllowed(TransitType type,
                                                  boolean allow)
        Sets whether a Public Transport Type is allowed. By default all types are allowed.
        Parameters:
        type - public transport type, see TransitType for valid values.
        allow - a boolean to allow/disallow a transit type
        Returns:
        The modified RouteOptions itself.

        Checks whether a Public Transport type is allowed.
        Parameters:
        type - One of the public transport TransitType values to check if it is allowed.
        Returns:
        true if allowed, otherwise false.

      • setTransitMinimumChangeTime

        public RouteOptions setTransitMinimumChangeTime(int minutes)
        Sets transit minimum change time. Any connection time below this value will be bumped up to the minimum. The default is zero.
        Parameters:
        minutes - time in minutes
        Returns:
        The modified RouteOptions itself.

      • getTransitMinimumChangeTime

        public int getTransitMinimumChangeTime()
        Gets transit minimum change time. Any connection time below this value will be bumped up to the minimum. The default is zero.
        Returns:
        time in minutes

      • setTransitMaximumChanges

        public RouteOptions setTransitMaximumChanges(int changes)
        Sets the maximum number of vehicle changes allowed during the trip.

        Note: For UMRouteOptions case maximum supported changes is 6.

        Parameters:
        changes - number of vehicle changes
        Returns:
        The modified RouteOptions itself.

      • getTransitMaximumChanges

        public int getTransitMaximumChanges()
        Gets the maximum number of vehicle changes allowed during the trip.
        Returns:
        number of vehicle changes

      • setTransitWalkTimeMultiplier

        public RouteOptions setTransitWalkTimeMultiplier(float value)
        Sets a multiplier to use for walking times. A higher number means a slower walking speed. The default is 1.0.

        Note: For UMRouteOptions case supported range is [0.5, 2.0].

        Parameters:
        value - multiplier
        Returns:
        The modified RouteOptions itself.

      • getTransitWalkTimeMultiplier

        public float getTransitWalkTimeMultiplier()
        Gets a multiplier to use for walking times. A higher number means a slower walking speed. The default is 1.0.
        Returns:
        multiplier

      • getTime

        public RouteOptions.TimeType getTime(java.util.Date date)
        Gets the arrival or departure time that has been set.
        Parameters:
        date - Output parameter where the date will be set. This may be null if the caller is only interested in the RouteOptions.TimeType.
        Returns:
        The TimeType of the parameter upon completion.

      • getRouteCount

        public int getRouteCount()
        Gets the current desired number of route
        Returns:
        current desired number of route

      • setRouteCount

        public RouteOptions setRouteCount(int count)
        Sets the desired number of route. The default is 1.

        Values greater than 10 are ignored if RouteOptions.TransportMode is set to public transport and online timetables are enabled. Only one route will be returned for routes with more than two RouteWaypoint.

        NOTE: If UMRouter is used, then allowed range is [1, 6]. Using unsupported value will result error response in route calculation.

        Parameters:
        count - route count
        Returns:
        The modified RouteOptions itself.

      • setStartDirection

        public RouteOptions setStartDirection(int dirInDegrees)
        The direction that routing should start in. Use values between 0..359. If a value greater than 359 is specified, the modulus of 360 is used. Specify RouteOptions::START_DIRECTION_ANY (or greater) to route in any direction.
        Parameters:
        dirInDegrees - Start direction in degrees. 0 is north, increases clockwise (ie. 90 is east).
        Returns:
        The modified RouteOptions itself.

      • getStartDirection

        public int getStartDirection()
        Returns the start direction. Defaults to RouteOptions::START_DIRECTION_ANY which means route in any direction in order to obtain the shortest/fastest possible route.
        Returns:
        The start direction in degrees, in the range 0..359, or RouteOptions::START_DIRECTION_ANY to route in any direction.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The modified RouteOptions itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the count is negative.

      • setTruckRestrictionsMode

        public void setTruckRestrictionsMode(RouteOptions.TruckRestrictionsMode mode)
        Sets truck restrictions handling mode. If no mode is explicitly set then NO_VIOLATIONS option will be used.
        Parameters:
        mode - The truck restrictions mode.

      • getTruckRestrictionsMode

        public RouteOptions.TruckRestrictionsMode getTruckRestrictionsMode()
        Retrieves currently set RouteOptions.TruckRestrictionsMode.
        Returns:
        Truck restrictions mode.

      • excludeRoutingZones

        public void excludeRoutingZones(java.util.List<java.lang.String> zoneIDs)
        Prevents route from using specified routing zones. All other routing zones will be used if necessary.

        Use Route.getRoutingZones() to get routing zones used in the route.

        Use RoutingZone.getId() to get zone identifier.

        Note: routing zones are supported only for RouteOptions.TransportMode.CAR, RouteOptions.TransportMode.TRUCK and RouteOptions.TransportMode.SCOOTER transport modes.

        IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Parameters:
        zoneIDs - A list of zone IDs to be excluded during route calculation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if provided list or its element is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if zoneIDs list or its element is empty.
        See Also:
        RoutingZone

      • excludeCountries

        public RouteOptions excludeCountries(java.util.List<java.lang.String> countries)
        Prevents creating a route through specified countries.

        Use RouteOptions.getExcludedCountries() to get excluded countries from the route.

        Note: the exclusion of the countries from the route is supported only for RouteOptions.TransportMode.CAR, RouteOptions.TransportMode.TRUCK transport modes. Country code must be in ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 format otherwise routing might fail.

        Note: In order to reset of excluded countries, you have to provide an empty list.

        IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.
        Parameters:
        countries - A list of countries to be excluded during route calculation.
        Returns:
        The modified RouteOptions itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if provided list or its element is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if countries list contains an empty country code.

      • getExcludedCountries

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getExcludedCountries()
        Returns list of excluded countries from routing.
        Returns:
        java.util.List<java.lang.String> that contains excluded countries. IMPORTANT: this is a BETA feature, and is subject to change without notice.

      • setDeviationDistanceToPedestrianReroute

        public void setDeviationDistanceToPedestrianReroute(int distance)
        Set the deviation distance to pedestrian reroute. Default distance is 50 m. This parameter available only for pedestrian route RouteOptions.TransportMode.PEDESTRIAN.
        Parameters:
        distance - The deviation distance to pedestrian reroute in meters.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If distance is not greater than zero.

      • getDeviationDistanceToPedestrianReroute

        public int getDeviationDistanceToPedestrianReroute()
        Returns the deviation distance to pedestrian reroute. Default distance is 50 m. This parameter available only for pedestrian route RouteOptions.TransportMode.PEDESTRIAN.
        Returns:
        The deviation distance to pedestrian reroute in meters.

      • setLicensePlateLastCharacter

        public RouteOptions setLicensePlateLastCharacter(java.lang.String character)
        Sets the last character of the vehicle's license plate.

        Enables route computation with respect to restrictions based on last digit rule on license plate number.

        Note: Restrictions are supported only for RouteOptions.TransportMode.CAR, RouteOptions.TransportMode.TRUCK and RouteOptions.TransportMode.SCOOTER transport modes.

        Parameters:
        character - The last character of the vehicle's license plate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If character string's length more than 1 or if it is not an alphanumeric character.

      • getLicensePlateLastCharacter

        public java.lang.String getLicensePlateLastCharacter()
        Gets the last character of the vehicle's license plate.

      • setLocale

        public void setLocale(java.util.Locale locale)
        Sets the language for route request using a locale.
        Parameters:
        locale - The language locale as described in http://developer.android.com/reference/java/util/Locale.htm.

      • getLocale

        public java.util.Locale getLocale()
        Gets the language for route request using a locale.
